definition: monarch
surname Guo
country/nation/state/national/CL:個|个[ge4]
monarch/lord/gentleman/ruler

sentences.english: Qingdafu is the largest-scale noble class under the leadership of the king.
sentences.chinese: 卿大夫家族是国君统御之下规模最大的贵族阶层。

sentences.english: Li Yu was more of a poet than a king.
sentences.chinese: 与其说李煜是一位国君，倒不如说他是一位诗人。

sentences.english: Sitting in the chariot was the great King of Chu.
sentences.chinese: 坐在车上的是伟大的楚国国君。

sentences.english: At that time the king called ZuYi, days of the contingency, made him very upset.
sentences.chinese: 那时的国君叫祖乙，天时风云的不测，使他很苦恼。

sentences.english: According to "Zuo Zhuan", Governor Hua was a magistrate who assisted the king to rule the country in the Song State.
sentences.chinese: 华督是《左传》记载的宋国辅佐国君的行政长官。

sentences.english: The king ordered his officers to inquire about the way, but failed to get any answer.
sentences.chinese: 国君派将士去打探，但没有一个人能找到回去的道路。

sentences.english: A monarch or any other leader must be a person with foresight, a kind heart, and courage.
sentences.chinese: 一个国君必须具有远见和仁慈的心及勇气。

sentences.english: But the man who'd been a king found he was now only a celebrity.
sentences.chinese: 不过曾为国君的他发现自己现在只是个名人。

sentences.english: In the Spring and Autumn Period, the struggle between monarchs and aristocrat officials was very fierce.
sentences.chinese: 春秋时期，国君们与世卿争夺权力的斗争十分激烈。

sentences.english: After the banquet, the minister handed in his resignation that very night.
sentences.chinese: 于是，宴会结束后，他连夜向国君递交了辞呈。

sentences.english: She monarch on the carriage ride, the mother came to visit.
sentences.chinese: 于是她就乘坐国君的马车，赶去看望母亲。

sentences.english: King Chulin, the king of the state of Chu, was very found of officials with slender waists.
sentences.chinese: 楚国的国君灵王是非常喜欢腰身纤细苗条的朝臣。

sentences.english: Today no one can say where Peru's greatest kings lie.
sentences.chinese: 今天谁也说不出秘鲁最重要的国君埋在哪里。

sentences.english: But the man who’d been a king found he was now only a 15)celebrity.
sentences.chinese: 不过曾为国君的他发现自己现在只是个名人。

sentences.english: In 361 BC, Duke Xiao came to the throne of the State of Qin.
sentences.chinese: 公元前361年，秦国的新国君秦孝公即位。

definition: Qi state of Western Zhou and the Warring states (1122-265 BC), centered in Shandong
Duke Huan of Qi (reigned 685-643 BC), one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
Lu, vassal state at the time of the Zhou Dynasty 周朝|周朝[Zhou1 chao2], located in the southwest of present-day Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1], birthplace of Confucius

feudal vassal/feudal princes, esp. the monarchs (dukes or princes) of the several vassal states 諸侯國|诸侯国 of Zhou during Western Zhou and Spring and Autumn periods 11th-5th century BC/subordinate warlord/local official
the state of Qin, one of the seven states of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
the state of Chu, one of the most important of the small states contending for power in China between 770 and 223 BC, located around present-day Hubei
Duke Mu of Qin, the first substantial king of Qin (ruled 659-621 BC), sometimes considered one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
Duke Wen of Jin (697-628 BC, reigned 636-628 BC), one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)
royal title
my late father/my ancestors/the late emperor
vassal state
former kings/former emperors/in Confucian writing, refers esp. to the sage rulers Yao 堯|尧[Yao2], Shun 舜[Shun4], Yu 禹[Yu3], Tang 湯|汤[Tang1] and the kings of Zhou
to defend one's country
state of Wei (c. 1040-209 BC), vassal of Zhou
vassal state
King Huiwen of Zhao 趙國|赵国, reigned 298-266 BC during the Warring States Period
